item.text: At that time Merodach Baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he heard that Hezekiah had been ill and had recovered.

<st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="08055 05921">welcomed</st><n id="1" /> them and <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them his <st data-num="01004 05238">storehouse</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> its <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="01314" class="">spices</st>, and <st data-num="02896" class="">high-quality</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>, as well as his <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="01004 03627">armory</st> and <st data-num="03605 0834 04672">everything</st> in his <st data-num="0214" class="">treasuries</st>. <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them <st data-num="03808 01961 01697 0834 03808 ">everything</st> in his <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st> and in his <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="04474" class="">kingdom</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="03470" class="">Isaiah</st> the <st data-num="05030" class="">prophet</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">visited</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> and <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> him, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> did <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>? <st data-num="0370" class="">Where</st> do they <st data-num="0935 0413">come</st> <st data-num="0370" class="">from</st>?” <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “They <st data-num="0935 0413">come</st> from the <st data-num="07350" class="">distant</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.”

Isaiah<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> have they <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> in your <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>?” <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “They have <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> in my <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>. I <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them <st data-num="03808 01961 01697 0834 03808">everything</st> in my <st data-num="0214" class="">treasuries</st>.”
Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Listen to the message of the Lord of Heaven’s Armies:
‘Look, a time is coming when everything in your palace and the things your ancestors have accumulated to this day will be carried away to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.

‘Some of your <st data-num="0834 03318 04480">very own</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> you <st data-num="03205" class="">father</st><n id="1" /> will be <st data-num="03947" class="">taken away</st> and will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> made <st data-num="05631" class="">eunuchs</st> in the <st data-num="01964" class="">palace</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.’”
Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The Lord’s message that you have announced is appropriate.” Then he thought, “For there will be peace and stability during my lifetime.”
